data.title: Lots of Pluses
data.text: First impression of the restaurant was that it's very attractive.  There was a singer seated by the front door (facing the bar) that had a great voice.  Host was friendly, which is always a good start.  Server arrived promptly.  We ordered the scallop and meatball appetizers, and both were great.  Our host asked the server about two bottles of wine, and his reply was "I've never sold either of them".  Not I will get the manager.  Not let me find someone to advise you.  We thought that was weird in a restaurant of this caliber.  We liked the sides (asparagus with a chipotle sauce which was a little too tame, and their homemade tater tots which were good).  I was a little disappointed in my steak which was not as good as the "other guy" in town.  Would go back to try some of their entrees, as they had a more extensive menu than "the other guy".   Would also be a great place for a happy hour drink and to listen to great live music.

data.title: Happy hour local
data.text: Prime do a great happy hour food and wine option. Look out for Thursday happy hour with half price on select bottles of wine.

data.title: Great food - slow service
data.text:
We were walk-ins last weekend and the restaurant was not real busy.  Waited 10 minutes with no waiter stopping by.  We were ready to go and a waiter dropped off the wine list.
At any rate, what should have been ah hour and a half experience was plus two hours with lots of wait time.  Chilean Sea Bass was wonderful and the scallops were average.
Ambience was nice - would have liked a bit more prompt service.

data.title: Very poor service
data.text:
Ate here as part of a part of seven on Tuesday 25th of October.
The food was fairly decent but not fantastic.
The service was very poor from start to finish and then the cheek to tell me they had charged a 20% service which was later removed after my complaint.

I would not recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Really enjoy the food, service, drinks and lively music. Great location also.  The service was amazing, the large food selections and the perfect way the steaks were prepared were amazing.

data.title: Seafood | steak
data.text: Brand new menu, incredible seafood with outstanding live music, now new restaurant Prime Cincinnati offer many city options with a great Veleta wine selection.

data.title: No service
data.text: We were hoping for a cocktail and dinner at the bar before a nearby concert.  We sat the bar for five minutes waiting for service or at least an acknowledgement that we were there.  After deciding that we had waited long enough, we dicided to go across the street to Boca.  I approached the desk to let them know about the lack of service.  The response of one of the hosts was deplorable!!  Shame on you!

data.title: Just your average restaurant
data.text:
Had dinner there for the first time before a show at the Aronoff since it was within walking distance of the theatre.  
Service was very good - 2 waiters gave us prompt attention.  
Shrimp cocktail was mediocre.  Sauce was different and not very good.
Caprese salad was tasty, bread was not. 
Filet was overcooked (I ordered medium) and dry.  Asparagus was fairly tasty as was twice-baked potato. 
Ambience was okay - nice view of the busy street and people hustling about. Table was not comfy as the extension kept sliding down onto my legs! 
We ate in the dining room which was pleasant and fairly quiet. However the bar area with live music was hopping - maybe that's the biggest plus for this place but I'm past that stage of life. 😉
I will not go there again as there are too many excellent restaurants in Cincy to choose from.  Too bad cause the location is great.

data.title: Birthday dinner
data.text: Took a friend for his birthday. The food was excellent. Try the brussel sprouts and the lobster. Of course with great steak. Look out for name change.

data.title: Restuarant Week Visit at Prime 47
data.text:
First time to this restaurant.  Didn't know it existed until I was reviewing the Cincinnati restaurant week participating locations.  Decided to give it a try based on the price fix menu.  We were not disappointed in the food.  Not only were they nice portions but the food was outstanding.  All I can say about the "half baked cookie" dessert is OMG!  The other food was great too but I am a dessert lover.  We are definitely going back.  

The only downside is traffic in downtown Cincinnati is crazy.  We had 5:15p reservations and there was a Bengals game.  We manage to arrive on time even with the traffic.  We took advantage of the Valet parking - totally worth it.  One tip about valet, even though the address is 580 Walnut, the front entrance and valet parking are actually on 5th St.  Since we were driving south on Walnut and 5th is a one way heading west, we had to go around the block and endure crazy traffic and pedestrians for a little longer.

data.title: Very good
data.text: We came here because we had a gift certificate our son received after buying FC Cincinnati season tix. Didn't know what to expect based on reviews and it doesn't ever look busy. We had an excellent steak dinner, great cocktails. Service was attentive and professional. Two waiters served us, they asked in advance whether we were on a schedule...we were not and had a nice, relaxing time. Music in the bar was loud, but in the dining room it sounded more like background, allowing for conversation. Music was soul/jazzy, lots of people in the bar dancing. As for comparing with Jeff Ruby, I prefer Prime 47. JR's is too noisy, tables too close together, simply chaotic...not my preference.

data.title: Great food if a little pricey
data.text:
if you try anything, try the calamari starter. It is simply superb. Had fillet and scallop main and was not disappointed, but that calamari - amazing. Try it and you'll no what I mean.
It is a little expensive which may explain why the place was very quiet plus we were unable to transfer our bar bill to our meal and had to settle at the bar before sitting down to eat. Seems a little strange. Overall though a great experience

data.title: Biz dinner
data.text:
Great location and very good steakhouse .
Not too loud so work conversation can get done. Steaks good  sides are very good (Brussels sprouts excellent )

Service attentive
If you are staying downtown or doing biz with krogers or Macys, this is an ideal dinner venue

data.title: If you haven't been here, you are missing out!
data.text: If you have not been to Prime 47 in Cincinnati, you are missing out. My wife, son and I went recently and had the best meal we have had in a long time. My son and I had the pork chop and we both thought it was absolutely exceptional. It was the best I have ever had. The sauce and sides were delicious. You owe it to yourself to try it. My wife had the salmon, which was a large piece perfectly cooked. She thought she had the prize of the night. The lobster bisque was creamy and delicious. The half baked cookie for dessert was to die for. We would order every item again. The service was attentive and friendly, even though they were busy. We loved every minute of our meal and are looking forward to visiting again soon.

data.title: Very good, but not the best in a competitive steakhouse city
data.text: We tried Prime 47 for the first time .... Probably the only steakhouse left in Cincinnati that we had not yet tried. It was very good, but for steakhouses in Cincinnati, very good is not good enough to survive in a very, very crowded and competitive market. Our gold standard remains the Jeff Ruby steakhouses throughout Cincinnati. Prime 47 has very good, prime, dry-aged steaks ... But not quite as good as Ruby's. Prime 47 has very good service, but not quite as good as Ruby's. Prime 47 has good ambiance and location ... But not quite as good as Ruby's. Other than their top-of-their-line bone-in ribeye, their prices are a bit lower than Ruby's. Their roasted Brussels sprouts (roasted in bacon and honey) are excellent. If Ruby wasn't here, Prime 47 would be a top notch steakhouse. But Ruby is here ....

data.title: Lunch but almost need to take vacation day it took so long
data.text:
Prime 47 is a real enigma.  I stopped by there today with a friend for lunch and sat outdoors in a very nice space facing 6th street.  Their menu is interesting and their lunch menu where all items are $12.00 was OK.

The good news...the staff were friendly, the food was very good and tasty.  I had a burger, they have many variations, and a side salad.  Better than I would expect to get in many downtown places.

The bad...it took forever. After waiting 30 min from the time we ordered I complained and was told the normal turnaround was 25 min to which I responded,..."the put that on your banner on the front or on your menu...this is a lunch hour"...within five min the food arrived.  It then took over 10 min to get the bill back after they had my card.

The food was tasty enough to give them another chance but they better fix the service.  I spoke with a friend who ate there recently and before I said anything told me "they are so slow there".  If you have lots of time go there...otherwise tread carefully.

data.title: Really disappointed
data.text:
Last night three of us went to Prime 47 for dinner. We had never been, but took advantage of the "$5 burger week" in Cincinnati to check it out. The truffle Mac and cheese we ordered was fabulous. The wine and mixed drinks were great. The burgers, however, were not cooked right, the Caesar salad was blah and a bit soggy, and the loaded potato soup was tepid. After letting the waitress know about the burgers, they brought two more, which also were not at the correct temperature. One of us chose medium rare, another medium, and the last medium well. The first three were all well done. The replacements also had no pink in them. 0/5. If a burger is that difficult to get right, how can I expect a steak to be cooked properly?
We visited a number of new places this week because of this promotion. It enticed us into checking out new places, and we found some great new restaurants that we will happily visit again. I'm sorry to say this won't be one of them.

data.title: If you're looking for a great steakhouse, look no further!
data.text: My wife and I had our second visit to Prime 47 last evening, because even though the first visit was exceptional, we weren't sure if that was an aberration or the norm. I'm happy to say that fantastic food and service are the norm at Prime 47! I've been to Ruby's, The Precinct, Morton's of Cincinnati, and Ruth's Chris in Cincinnati, and Prime 47 is at least as good, and in many ways better, than all of the above. My wife had a sea bass entree and I had a filet, and both were prepared to perfection. We accompanied those with a roasted potato side, which was also fabulous. The potatoes were combined with mushrooms, all delicately roasted and seasoned with a delightful, savory preparation. The service was quick and attentive, and the wait staff all provided solid information when we had questions. I know it will be tough for a city the size of Cincinnati to support as many steakhouses as it currently has, but Prime 47 deserves to be one that remains.

data.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
data.text: Sat in the bar area with live music. Great vibe and ambiance. Excellent service. We read the reviews prior to going and they were so-so. The food ended up being excellent, and we got a lot for the cost. We'll definitely be back.

data.title: Excellent Easter Brunch
data.text: Went for Easter bruch.  Food and service was excellent. Super Jumbo shrimp, Prime rib, ham, beef wellington, eggs benedict, and their special lobster mac n cheese and truffle macn cheese.fruit salad, caesar salad, and mixed greens salad were nice. Smoked salmon,capers and eggs too. They also made omelettes and had french toast. The only thing missing was cooked veggies.Desserts were simple but good: key lime squares, sea salt brownies and carrot cake cupcakes. Unlimited mimosas for$12.
